englishTranslationText:
Read	with	the	name	of	your	Lord	Who	
created,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Pardho	pane	Rab	ke	nām	se	jis	ne	paidā	
kiyā

englishTranslationText: Created	man	from	a	clot.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āadmi	ko	khoon	ki	phatak	se	banāyā.

englishTranslationText:
Read,	and	your	Lord	only	is	the	Most	
Beneficent,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Padho	aur	tumhārā	Rab	hi	sab	se	badā	
karim.

englishTranslationText: The	One	Who	taught	to	write	with	the	pen.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	qalam	se	likhnā	sikhāyā

englishTranslationText:
The	One	Who	taught	man	all	what	he	did	
not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ādmi	ko	sikhāyā	jo	na	jāntā	thā

englishTranslationText: Yes	indeed,	man	is	surely	rebellious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	be-shak	āadmi	sarkashi	kartā	hai

englishTranslationText: As	he	considers	himself	independent!
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	par	ke	apne	āp	ko	ghani	samajh	liyā

englishTranslationText: Indeed	towards	your	Lord	only	is	the	return.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	tumhāre	Rab	hi	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai

englishTranslationText: What	is	your	opinion	–	regarding	him	who	forbids	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	jo	man’a	kartā	hai.

englishTranslationText: A	bondman	when	he	offers	the	prayer?
romanUrduTranslationText: Bande	ko	jab	woh	Namāz	padhe

englishTranslationText: What	is	your	opinion	–	if	he	were	upon	guidance,
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	agar	woh	hidāyat	par	hotā.

englishTranslationText: He	would	enjoin	piety,	so	how	good	it	would	be!
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	parhezgāri	batātā	to	kiyā	khoob	thā.

englishTranslationText: What	is	your	opinion	–	if	he	denies	and	turns	away,	how	wretched	will	be	his	state!
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	agar	jhutlāyā	aur	muñh	pherā

englishTranslationText: Did	he	not	realise	that	Allah	is	watching?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	ḥāl	hogā	kyā	na	jānā	ke	Allāh	dekh	rahā	hai

arabicText: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
englishTranslationText: Yes	certainly,	if	he	does	not	desist,	We	will	seize	him	by	the	forelock.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	agar	b’az	na	āayā	to	ham	zaror	peshāni	ke	bāl	pakad	kar	kheeñcheñ	ge

englishTranslationText: A	forelock	that	lies,	is	sinful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kaisi	peshāni	jhooti	khaṭā	kār.

englishTranslationText: So	let	him	now	call	his	gang!
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	pukāre	apni	majlis	ko

englishTranslationText: We	will	now	call	the	guards!
romanUrduTranslationText: Abhi	Ham	sipāhiyoñ	ko	bulāte	haiñ

englishTranslationText:
Yes	indeed;	do	not	listen	to	him	-	and	prostrate,	and	become	close	to	Us.		
(Command	of	Prostration	#	14)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hāñ	hāñ	us	ki	na	suno	aur	Sajda	karo	aur	ham	se	qareeb	ho	jāo.		
(Sajde	ka	hukm	#	14)

englishTranslationText:
Yes	indeed;	do	not	listen	to	him	-	and	prostrate,	and	become	close	to	Us.		
(Command	of	Prostration	#	14)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hāñ	hāñ	us	ki	na	suno	aur	Sajda	karo	aur	ham	se	qareeb	ho	jāo.		
(Sajde	ka	hukm	#	14)

englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	sent	down	the	Qur’an	in	the	
Night	of	Destiny.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Ham	ne	usey	Shab-e-Qadr	meiñ	
utārā

englishTranslationText:
And	what	have	you	understood,	what	the	
Night	of	Destiny	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	ne	kyā	jānā	kyā	Shab-e-Qadr.

arabicText: لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
The	Night	of	Destiny	is	better	than	a	
thousand	months.
romanUrduTranslationText: Shab-e-Qadr	hazār	mahinoñ	se	behtar

arabicText: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
In	it	descend	the	angels	and	Jibreel,	by	the	
command	of	their	Lord	–	for	all	works.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	meiñ	Farishte	aur	Jibreel	uatarte	haiñ	
apne	Rab	ke	ḥukm	se	har	kām	ke	liye

englishTranslationText: It	is	peace	until	the	rising	of	dawn.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	salāmati	hai	subaḥ	chamakne	tak

arabicText: لَمْ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
englishTranslationText:
The	disbelieving	People	of	the	Book(s)	and	
the	polytheists	would	not	have	left	their	
religion	until	the	clear	proof	came	to	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kitābi	Kāfir	aur	mushrik	apnā	din	chordne	
ko	na	the	jab	tak	un	ke	pās	raushan	dalil	na	
āye

arabicText: رَسُولٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتْلُوا۟ صُحُفًۭا مُّطَهَّرَةًۭ
englishTranslationText:
(The	clear	proof	is)	the	Noble	Messenger	
from	Allah,	who	reads	the	pure	pages.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh kaun woh	Allāh	ka	Rasool	ki	pāk	saḥife	
pardhtā	hai

englishTranslationText: In	which	are	written	proper	affairs.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	sidhi	bāteñ	likhi	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
englishTranslationText:
Nor	did	the	People	of	the	Book(s)	get	
divided	until	after	the	clear	proof	came	to	
them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	phoot	na	pardi	kitāb	wāloñ	meiñ	magar	
b’ad	is	ke	ki	woh	roushan	daleel	un	ke	pās	
tashreef	lāye

arabicText: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلْقَيِّمَةِ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	were	ordered	only	to	worship	Allah,	believing	purely	in	Him	–	devoted	solely	(to	Him),	
and	to	establish	the	prayer	and	to	pay	the	obligatory	charity	–	and	this	is	the	straight	religion.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	logoñ	ko	to	yahi	ḥukm	huā	ke	Allāh	ki	bandagi	kareñ	nire	usi	par	‘aqidah	late	aik	ṭaraf	ke	
ho	kar	aur	Namāz	qāim	kareñ	aur	Zakat	deñ	aur	yeh	seedhā	deen	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ فِى نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	all	disbelievers,	the	People	of	the	Book(s)	and	the	polytheists,	are	in	the	fire	of	hell	–	they	
will	remain	in	it	for	ever;	it	is	they	who	are	the	worst	among	the	creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jitney	kāfir	haiñ	kitābi	aur	mushrik	sab	Jahannam	ki	āg	meiñ	haiñ	hamesha	us	meiñ	
raheñge	wahi	tamām	makhloq	meiñ	badtar	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	accepted	faith	and	did	good	deeds	–	it	is	they	who	are	the	best	among	the	
creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kye	wohi	tamām	makhloq	meiñ	behtar	haiñ

arabicText: جَزَآؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًۭا ۖ رَّضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِىَ رَبَّهُۥ
englishTranslationText:
Their	reward	is	-	with	their	Lord	-	
everlasting	Gardens	of	Eden	beneath	which	
rivers	flow,	in	which	they	will	abide	for	ever	
and	ever;	Allah	is	pleased	with	them	and	
they	are	pleased	with	Him;	this	is	for	one	
who	fears	his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	kā	sila	un	ke	Rab	ke	pās	basne	ke	bāgh	
haiñ	jin	ke	neeche	nahreñ	baheñ	un	meiñ	
hamesha	hamesha	raheñ	Allāh	un	se	rāzi	
aur	woh	Us	se	rāzi	ye	us	ke	liye	hai	jo	apne	
Rab	se	dare.

englishTranslationText:
When	the	earth	is	shaken	with	its	
appointed	tremor.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	zameen	thartharā	di	jāye	jaisā	us	kā	
thartharānā	thahrā	hai

englishTranslationText: And	the	earth	throws	out	its	burdens.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	zameen	apne	bojh	bāhar	phaink	de

englishTranslationText: And	man	says,	“What	has	happened	to	it?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āadmi	kahe	isey	kyā	huā

englishTranslationText: On	that	day	earth	will	narrate	its	news,
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	woh	apni	khabreñ	batāyegi

englishTranslationText: Because	your	Lord	sent	a	command	to	it.	,
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	liye	ke	tumhāre	Rab	ne	usey	ḥukm	bhejā

arabicText: يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَصْدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًۭا لِّيُرَوْا۟ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
englishTranslationText:
On	that	day	men	will	return	towards	their	
Lord,	in	different	groups,	in	order	to	be	
shown	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	din	log	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	phireñge	kayi	
rāh	ho	kar	takay	apnā	kiyā	dikhāye	jāyeñ.

arabicText: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًۭا يَرَهُۥ
englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	does	a	good	deed	equal	to	the	
weight	of	the	minutest	particle,	will	see	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jo	aik	žarra	bhar	bhalāyi	kare	usey	
dekhegā.

arabicText: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍۢ شَرًّۭا يَرَهُۥ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	does	an	evil	deed	equal	to	
the	weight	of	the	minutest	particle,	will	see	
it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	aik	žarra	bhar	burāyi	kare	usey	
dekhegā

englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	those	that	sprint,	breathing	heavily.	(The	horses	used	in	Holy	War.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Qasam	un	ki	jo	daurdte	haiñ	seene	se	āawāz	nikalti	huyi

englishTranslationText: Striking	stones	with	their	hooves,	sparking	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	paththroñ	se	āg	nikālte	haiñ	sum	mār	kar

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	those	who	raid	at	dawn.		.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	subaḥ	hote	tārāj	karte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: So	thereupon	raising	dust.		.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	us	waqt	ghubār	udāte	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: Then	penetrate	to	the	centre	of	the	enemy	army.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	dushman	ke	beech	lashkar	meiñ	jāte	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	man	is	very	ungrateful	towards	his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ādmi	apne	Rab	kā	badā	nā-shukra	hai

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	he	himself	is	a	witness	to	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	woh	is	par	khud	gawāh	hai.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	he	loves	wealth	to	the	extreme.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	woh	māl	ki	chāhat	meiñ	zaroor	karrā	hai

arabicText: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ
englishTranslationText: So	does	he	not	know?	When	those	in	the	graves	are	raised.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	nahiñ	jāntā	jab	uthāye	jāyeñ	ge	jo	qabroñ	meiñ	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	all	what	lies	in	the	breasts	is	opened
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	khol	di	jāye	gi	jo	seenoñ	meiñ	hai.

englishTranslationText:
On	that	day	their	Lord	surely	knows	all	
about	them!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	un	ke	Rab	ko	us	din	un	ki	sab	
khabar	hai!
